page.title: 15FARMING IN ARNPRIOR
page.content: Of the 10 farms approximately 950 acres are arable, but some hay and silage is also taken from land identified as pasture. The predominant crops are barley (540 acres) and hay (420 acres), but other crops include wheat (34 acres), rape (32 acres), oats (65 acres), turnips (60 acres), peas (30 acres), and potatoes (15 acres). One farmer also has 4 acres of strawberries and the 3 tons of fruit yielded are sold either directly to visitors or to the Glagow fruit market. Typical yields per acre for other crops are 2 tons of barley, 3 tons of hay, 4 tons of wheat, and 12 tons of potatoes. Most of the crops are used or sold for animal fodder, but the barley is often sold for malting for whisky.
